channel.title: Webclient Creator Script [v0.0.1 Alpha]
channel.description:
Found this thing on my Dropbox. I made it a long time ago have have sharpened up on my PHP skills quite a bit, but I still have some learning to do.
[b]Features (v0.0.1):[/b]
Registration Login Create Client Play Client Dashboard
[b]Included in v0.0.2 (Next Release):[/b]
Edit Server Delete/Ban Server Administration Dashboard
[b]Known Issues (Current): [/b]
Insecure sessions Code clutter No template system Multiple tweaks and improvements
[b]Download:[/b] [url=https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/107769896/maker/v0.0.1.zip]Alpha Release v0.0.1[/url]
Due to it's early release, and not much dusting off - I will need reports of bugs within the script. Please be kind enough to report them! Also, do not criticize the code, it's over a year old.

item.title: Webclient Creator Script [v0.0.1 Alpha]
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

Not posting any pictures. It really doesn’t make a difference to me if you leech my work or not, so I’m not pitching the product.

EDIT: Finishing up the new registration system. Have a looksie.

<?php
	/*
	*
	*	Webclient Creator (c) 2015 - Cory Allen
	*
	*/
	require 'h2o.php';
	require_once 'private/config.site.php';
	require_once 'private/config.database.php';
	$h2o = new h2o('public/templates/default/register.html');
	$errors = null;
	$success = null;
	$page = array(); # Page Array - Keep it simple st00pid
	$page['title'] = "Register"; # Page title
	$page['siteName'] = $siteConfig['siteName']; # Site name
	# Registration functionality 
	if( isset($_POST['register']) ) {
	
		if( empty($_POST['username'] || $_POST['password'] || $_POST['password2'] || $_POST['email'] || $_POST['email2']) ) # All fields filled in?
			$errors .= 'You have left a field empty.<br />';
		if( strlen($_POST['username']) < $siteConfig['minUsernameLength'] )	# Username too short?
			$errors .= 'Your username must be longer than ' . $siteConfig['minUsernameLength'] . ' characters!<br />';
		if( strlen($_POST['username']) > $siteConfig['maxUsernameLength'] )	# Username too long?
			$errors .= 'Your username must be shorter than ' . $siteConfig['maxUsernameLength'] . ' characters!<br />';
		if( $_POST['email'] != $_POST['email2'] )	# Emails match?
			$errors .= 'The entered email addresses do not match!<br />';
		if( $_POST['password'] != $_POST['password2'] )	# Passwords match?
			$errors .= 'The entered passwords do not match!<br />';
		$query = $conn->prepare( "SELECT username FROM users WHERE username = ?" ); # Check if the username exists...
		$query->bindValue( 1, $_POST['username']);
		$query->execute();
		if( $query->rowCount() > 0 ) 
			$errors = "Sorry that username exists already.<br />";
		if(filter_var($_POST['email'], FILTER_VALIDATE_EMAIL) && $_POST['password'] == $_POST['password2'] && empty($errors)) { # Valid email, passwords match and no errors exist? Insert some data!
			$hashed_password = password_hash($_POST['password'], PASSWORD_BCRYPT); # Hash the password with bCrypt... GOODLUCK HACKERS
			$query = $conn->prepare("INSERT INTO users (username, password, email) VALUES (:username, :password, :email)");
			$query->bindParam(':username', $_POST['username']);
			$query->bindParam(':password', $hashed_password);
			$query->bindParam(':email', $_POST['email']);
			$query->execute();
			$success = 'You have successfully registered on our site! Please visit the login page!';
		} else {
			$errors .= 'You have to enter a valid email address!<br />';
		}	
	}
	$page['formErrors'] = $errors; # Assign the errors variable
	$page['formSuccess'] = $success;
	echo $h2o->render(compact('page'));	#Render our page
?>

Register.html:

{%include "header.html"%}
	<div class="row">
		<div class="col-md-8">
			{% if page.formErrors != null %}
				<div class="alert alert-danger">
					<h3>You've got some errors to check over!</h3>
					{{page.formErrors | safe}}
				</div>
			{%endif%}
			{% if page.formSuccess %}
				<div class="alert alert-success">
					{{page.formSuccess | safe}}
				</div>
			{%endif%}
			<form action="register.php" method="POST">
				<div class="form-group">
					<label class="control-label" for="inputDefault">Username</label>
					<input type="text" class="form-control" id="inputDefault" name="username">
				</div>
				<div class="form-group">
					<label class="control-label" for="inputDefault">Password</label>
					<input type="password" class="form-control" id="inputDefault" name="password">
				</div>
				<div class="form-group">
					<label class="control-label" for="inputDefault">Confirm Password</label>
					<input type="password" class="form-control" id="inputDefault" name="password2">
				</div>
				<div class="form-group">
					<label class="control-label" for="inputDefault">Email</label>
					<input type="text" class="form-control" id="inputDefault" name="email">
				</div>
				<div class="form-group">
					<label class="control-label" for="inputDefault">Confirm Email</label>
					<input type="text" class="form-control" id="inputDefault" name="email2">
				</div>
				<div class="form-group">
					<button type="submit" name="register" class="btn btn-primary">Submit</button>
				</div>
			</form>
		</div>
		<div class="col-md-4">
			<h2>Benefits!</h2>
			<p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur. Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum.</p>
		</div>
	</div>
{%include "footer.html"%}

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient Creator Script [v0.0.1 Alpha]
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“RevengePK, post:7, topic:549676”][quote author=justaguy link=topic=668564.msg4471291#msg4471291 date=1423092977]
Did a brief skim over the code and noticed 3 things:

  1. Regenerate the session ID when they login successfully to prevent session fixation attacks.
  2. Implement CSRF protection because it is possible for me to log you out remotely (haven’t checked any other parts of the script).
  3. More so a suggestion but maybe get a template engine like Mustache so you can seperate your views from your logic? Makes it look much cleaner.
    [/quote]

I made this wayyyy before me and you had our little educational discussion on the first two. As for Mustache - I’m going to look into it. I’ve been looking for a good template engine and was previously using Rain.tpl but it acted funky with returning multiple database results.[/quote]

No worries! Just helping report bugs.

Read full topic

[quote=“justaguy, post:6, topic:549676”]Did a brief skim over the code and noticed 3 things:

  1. Regenerate the session ID when they login successfully to prevent session fixation attacks.
  2. Implement CSRF protection because it is possible for me to log you out remotely (haven’t checked any other parts of the script).
  3. More so a suggestion but maybe get a template engine like Mustache so you can seperate your views from your logic? Makes it look much cleaner. :)[/quote]

I made this wayyyy before me and you had our little educational discussion on the first two. As for Mustache - I’m going to look into it. I’ve been looking for a good template engine and was previously using Rain.tpl but it acted funky with returning multiple database results.

item.title: Webclient Creator Script [v0.0.1 Alpha]
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

Did a brief skim over the code and noticed 3 things:

  1. Regenerate the session ID when they login successfully to prevent session fixation attacks.
  2. Implement CSRF protection because it is possible for me to log you out remotely (haven’t checked any other parts of the script).
  3. More so a suggestion but maybe get a template engine like Mustache so you can seperate your views from your logic? Makes it look much cleaner.

Read full topic
